title: What to Know About Supreme Court Nomination Process and Biden’s Potential Picks
sub_head: Here is a look at process to nominate and confirm a successor as Justice Stephen Breyer goes into retirement
body:
Supreme Court Justice Stephen Breyer, who has served nearly three decades on the court, said Jan. 27 in a letter to President Biden that he plans to retire at the end of the current term.
Justice Breyer, 83 years old, was appointed by President Clinton in 1994. His retirement gives Mr. Biden an opportunity to shore up the Supreme Court’s liberal wing for decades and deliver on his promise to nominate the court’s first Black woman.
